original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.34. Hetuduka, Atītārammaṇattika🔽Nahetuṁ naatītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu atītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ naanāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā hetu anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  hetu duka atīta ārammaṇa ttika  na hetum na atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na hetum na anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paccayā hetu anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Reversal of the Conditions🔽The Triad of Conditions

original: Nahetuṁ napaccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetum na paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca hetu paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a condition being a state that is not a cause and not having an object that is past as condition, a state that is a cause and has an object that is past arises. … With a condition being a state that is not a cause and not having an object that is future as condition, a state that is a cause and has an object that is future arises. … With a condition being a state that is not a cause and not having an object that is present as condition, a state that is a cause and has an object that is present arises. …
